Package evaluation

Class SimulationEvaluator

  • java.lang.Object
    • evaluation.SimulationEvaluator

  • public class SimulationEvaluator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class can be used to retrieve several values from the databases that store the simulation monitoring values.
    Author:
    nilsw

      • getAvailableRecordTableNames

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAvailableRecordTableNames​()
        Retrieves a list of names of all tables within the connected database.
        Returns:
        List of names of all tables within the connected database.

      • getSimStartTime

        public java.util.Date getSimStartTime​()

      • getAllRecords

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAllRecords​(java.lang.String tableName,
                                                           java.util.Date startDate,
                                                           java.util.Date endDate,
                                                           ColumnType column)
        Retrieves all records of a specific column of a database table that have TIMESTAMP values between the specified start and end dates.
        Parameters:
        tableName - Name of the table from which the records are requested.
        startDate - Start date of the interval for the selection of records.
        endDate - End date of the interval for the selection of records.
        column - Column of the table for which all recorded values in the specified interval are returned.
        Returns:
        List of strings, where each string contains the evaluation record (including times of the records) entry for all data values of the specified column that lie between the specified dates.

      • getTotalSum

        public double getTotalSum​(java.lang.String tableName,
                          java.util.Date startDate,
                          java.util.Date endDate,
                          ColumnType column)
        Retrieves the total sum of all record values of a column of a database table. Thereby, the records are filtered by their timestamps.
        Parameters:
        tableName - Name of the table for which the total sum of records from one column is requested.
        startDate - Start date of the interval that is used for the selection of summed records.
        endDate - End date of the interval that is used for the selection of summed records.
        column - Column from which the values are summed.
        Returns:
        Sum of all selected data values from the specified column.

      • getStatistic

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> getStatistic​(StatisticType statisticType,
                                                          java.lang.String tableName,
                                                          java.util.Date startDate,
                                                          java.util.Date endDate,
                                                          ColumnType statisticColumn,
                                                          long millisecondsPerTimestep)
        Uses a specific statistic to aggregate the data values of a specified column of a database table.
        Parameters:
        statisticType - Statistic that is used to aggregate the data values.
        tableName - Name of the table from which the data is retrieved.
        startDate - Start date of the interval in which the TIMESTAMP values of the selected records have to be.
        endDate - End date of the interval in which the TIMESTAMP values of the selected records have to be.
        statisticColumn - Column from which the data values are aggregated.
        millisecondsPerTimestep - Amount of milliseconds that each aggregation interval contains.
        Returns:
        Time series data of the data value from the specified column in the specified database table. The TIMESTAMP values of the records from which the data values are taken have to be in the specified interval. The time series data interval basis is defined by the millisecondsPerTimestep parameter.
